str2: From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
A refreshing, refreshment. From anapsucho; properly, a recovery of breath, i.e. revival.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To appoint, choose, elect, take into hand.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
